channel.description:
mouse acceleration
& no I'm totally not mad that I spent £15 on a shitty game that I can't even play because moving the mouse gives inconsistent aiming

item.title: How to instantly ruin a game
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Davidi2:

That’s why I play with mice that have adjustable sensitivity settings.

I’m not talking about sensitivity, I’m talking about mouse acceleration in games where you can’t disable it

mouse acceleration: the position of the cursor will vary depending on how fast your mouse is moving, with NO acceleration 1 inch of mouse movement will be the same in game regardless of how fast or slow the mouse is moved, with mouse acceleration enabled an inch moved fast can move your character more than 10 inches moved slowly

eczema3:

first thing I do when I install windows

if it’s not clear what I’m talking about, when I move my mouse say 3 inches, I expect my in game character to move a fixed distance, I can move 3 inches however fast I want and I’ll always move my character the same amount of distance, with mouse acceleration enabled however I now have to move the mouse 3 inches but keep the speed I move exactly the same if I want a similar distance moved, so instead of just aiming the mouse to aim my character I have to aim my mouse and keep the speed consistent or the character behaves unexpectedly, i.e., you move your mouse 3 inches and expect to do a 180, instead you do a 360 and bam you’re dead because someone shot you
